bill of exchange.translation[0].definiti: a signed document ordering someone to pay someone else a particular amount of money
bill of exchange.translation[1].definiti: a document ordering someone to pay a particular amount on a fixed date, used especially in international trade
The exporter’s bank sends the bill of exchange to its overseas branch in the importer’s country.
When the buyer accepts a bill of exchange (=agrees to pay it), the exporter may arrange for it to be discounted.
Essing dishonoured fourbills of exchange (=failed to pay them) drawn by Byrd to the amount of £2.39 million.
